==Events==
*  [[23]] &ndash; Rebels capture and sack the Chinese capital [[Chang'an]] during a [[Lülin|peasant rebellion]]. They kill and decapitate the emperor, [[Wang Mang]], two days later.
* [[610]] &ndash; [[Heraclius]] arrives by ship from [[Africa (province)|Africa]] at [[Constantinople]], overthrows [[Byzantine Empire|Byzantine]] Emperor [[Phocas]] and becomes Emperor.
*[[1227]] &ndash; Assassination of [[Abdallah al-Adil|Caliph al-Adil]].
*[[1302]] &ndash; A peace treaty between the [[Byzantine Empire]] and the [[Republic of Venice]] ends the [[Byzantine–Venetian War (1296–1302)]].
*[[1363]] &ndash; End of the [[Battle of Lake Poyang]]; the [[Red Turban Rebellion|Chinese rebel forces]] of [[Zhu Yuanzhang]] defeat that of his rival, [[Chen Youliang]], in one of the [[Largest naval battle in history|largest naval battles in history]].
*[[1511]] &ndash; Formation of the [[War of the League of Cambrai|Holy League]] of [[Ferdinand II of Aragon]], the [[Papal States]] and the [[Republic of Venice]] against [[France]].
*[[1535]] &ndash; The first complete [[English-language]] [[Bible]] (the [[Coverdale Bible]]) is printed, with translations by [[William Tyndale]] and [[Miles Coverdale]].
*[[1582]] &ndash; [[Pope Gregory XIII]] implements the [[Gregorian Calendar]]. In Italy, Poland, Portugal, and Spain, October 4 of this year is followed directly by [[October 15]].
*[[1597]] &ndash; The first [[Guale]] uprising begins against the [[Spanish missions in Georgia]].
*[[1636]] &ndash; The [[Swedish Army]] defeats the armies of [[Saxony]] and the [[Holy Roman Empire]] at the [[Battle of Wittstock]].
*[[1693]] &ndash; [[Battle of Marsaglia]]: Piedmontese troops are defeated by the French.
*[[1725]] &ndash; Foundation of [[Rosario, Santa Fe|Rosario]] in [[Argentina]].
*[[1777]] &ndash; [[Battle of Germantown]]: Troops under [[George Washington]] are repelled by [[Great Britain|British]] troops under Sir [[William Howe, 5th Viscount Howe|William Howe]].
*[[1779]] &ndash; The [[James Wilson|Fort Wilson Riot]] takes place.
*[[1795]] &ndash; [[Napoleon I of France|Napoleon Bonaparte]] first rises to national prominence with a "Whiff of Grapeshot", using cannon to suppress armed counter-revolutionary rioters threatening the French Legislature ([[National Convention]]).
*[[1824]] &ndash; [[Mexico]] adopts a [[1824 Constitution of Mexico|new constitution]] and becomes a federal republic.
*[[1830]] &ndash; Creation of the Kingdom of [[Belgium]] after separation from the [[Netherlands]].
*[[1853]] &ndash; [[Crimean War]]: The [[Ottoman Empire]] declares war on [[Russia]].
*[[1876]] &ndash; [[Texas A&M University]] opens as the Agricultural and Mechanical College of Texas, becoming the first public institution of higher education in [[Texas]].
*[[1883]] &ndash; First run of the ''[[Orient Express]].''
*  1883   &ndash; First meeting of the [[Boys' Brigade]] in [[Glasgow]], [[Scotland]].
*[[1895]] &ndash; The first [[U.S. Open (golf)|U.S. Open Men's Golf Championship]] administered by the [[United States Golf Association]] is played at the [[Newport Country Club]] in [[Newport, Rhode Island]].
*[[1917]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Broodseinde]] fought between the British and German armies in Flanders.
*[[1918]] &ndash; An explosion kills more than 100 and destroys the [[T. A. Gillespie Company Shell Loading Plant explosion|T.A. Gillespie Company Shell Loading Plant]] in [[Sayreville, New Jersey]]. Fires and explosions continue for three days forcing massive evacuations and spreading ordnance over a wide area, pieces of which were still being found as of 2007.
*[[1927]] &ndash; [[Gutzon Borglum]] begins sculpting [[Mount Rushmore]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; Meeting between [[Adolf Hitler]] and [[Benito Mussolini]] at the [[Brenner Pass]].
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[Norman Rockwell]]'s [[Willie Gillis]] character debuts on the cover of the ''[[Saturday Evening Post]]''.
*[[1943]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: U.S. captures [[Solomon Islands]].
*[[1957]] &ndash; [[Space Race]]: Launch of ''[[Sputnik I]]'', the first artificial satellite to orbit the Earth.
*  1957   &ndash; [[Avro Arrow]] roll-out ceremony at [[Avro Canada]] plant in [[Malton, Ontario]].
*  1957   &ndash; ''[[Leave It To Beaver]]'' premieres on CBS.
*[[1958]] &ndash; [[French Fifth Republic|Fifth Republic]] of [[France]] is established.
*[[1960]] &ndash; [[Eastern Air Lines Flight 375]], a [[Lockheed L-188 Electra]], crashes after a [[bird strike]] on takeoff from [[Boston]]'s [[Logan International Airport]], killing 62 of 72 on board.
*[[1963]] &ndash; [[Hurricane Flora]], kills 6,000 in [[Cuba]] and [[Haiti]].
*[[1965]] &ndash; [[Pope Paul VI]] arrives in [[New York]], the first [[Pope]] to visit the [[United States of America]] and the Western hemisphere.
*[[1966]] &ndash; [[Basutoland]] becomes independent from the [[United Kingdom]] and is renamed [[Lesotho]].
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Omar Ali Saifuddin III]] of [[Brunei]] abdicates in favour of his son, His Majesty Sultan [[Hassanal Bolkiah]].
*[[1974]] &ndash; Founding of the [[New Democracy (Greece)|New Democracy]] party in [[Greece]].
*[[1976]] &ndash; Official launch of the [[Intercity 125]] [[High Speed Train]] (HST).
*[[1983]] &ndash; [[Richard Noble]] sets a new [[land speed record]] of {{Convert|633.468|mph|km/h}}, driving [[Thrust 2]] at the [[Black Rock Desert]] in [[Nevada]].
*[[1985]] &ndash; The [[Free Software Foundation]] is founded in [[Massachusetts]], [[United States]].
*[[1988]] &ndash; [[United States|U.S.]] [[televangelist]] [[Jim Bakker]] is indicted for fraud.
*[[1991]] &ndash; The [[Protocol on Environmental Protection to the Antarctic Treaty]] is opened for [[signature]].
*[[1992]] &ndash; The [[Rome General Peace Accords]] ends a 16 year [[civil war]] in Mozambique.
*  1992   &ndash; [[El Al Flight 1862]]: an [[El Al]] [[Boeing 747]]-258F crashes into two apartment buildings in [[Amsterdam]], killing 43 including 39 on the ground.
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[Russian constitutional crisis of 1993|Russian Constitutional Crisis]]: In [[Moscow]], [[tank]]s bombard the [[White House of Russia|White House]], a government building that housed the [[State Duma|Russian parliament]], while demonstrators against [[President of Russia|President]] [[Boris Yeltsin]] rally outside.
*[[1997]] &ndash; The [[Loomis Fargo Bank Robbery (1997)|second largest cash robbery]] in U.S. history occurs at the [[Charlotte, North Carolina]] office of [[Wells Fargo|Loomis, Fargo and Company]].  A [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]] investigation eventually results in 24 convictions and the recovery of approximately 95% of the $17.3 million stolen cash.
*[[2001]] &ndash; [[NATO]] confirms invocation of Article 5 of the [[North Atlantic Treaty]].
*  2001   &ndash; [[Siberia Airlines Flight 1812]]: a Sibir Airlines [[Tupolev]] [[Tupolev Tu-154|TU-154]] crashes into the [[Black Sea]] after being struck by an errant Ukrainian [[SA-5 Gammon|S-200]] missile. 78 people are killed.
*[[2003]] &ndash; [[Maxim restaurant suicide bombing]] in [[Haifa]], [[Israel]]:  21 Israelis, [[Jew]]s and [[Arab]]s, are killed, and 51 others wounded.
*[[2004]] &ndash; ''[[SpaceShipOne]]'' wins [[Ansari X Prize]] for [[private spaceflight]], by being the first private craft to fly into space.
*[[2010]] &ndash; The [[Ajka alumina plant accident|Ajka plant accident]] in western [[Hungary]] releases about a million cubic metres (35 million cubic feet) of liquid [[Red mud|alumina sludge]]. Nine people are killed and 122 injured, and the [[Marcal]] and [[Danube]] rivers are severely contaminated.
